placeDesc:
The Bakken Museum was founded in 1975 by Earl E. Bakken, inventor of the first transistorized cardiac pacemaker, and includes a great variety of innovations.
Inside the museum you can find Wimshurst Machines, pacemaker collections, and Ben Franklin’s Electricity Party Room all in the setting of a classic 1930s Tudor Mansion.
placeShortDesc: A museum dedicated to the exploring past, present, and future innovations.
placeRelatedPlaces: ['Museo de Anatomopatología (Museum of Pathological Anatomy)', 'Russian Museum of Military Medicine', 'Historic Street Lighting Museum', 'Museum of Malformations of the Human Body']
